demo: Could someone in Tokyo take a taxi to the The Metropolitan Museum of Art###First, the person in Tokyo would need to get to an airport. Then, they would need to fly to New York City. Once they arrived in New York City, they would need to take a taxi to the The Metropolitan Museum of Art. So, yes, it is possible for someone in Tokyo to take a taxi to the The Metropolitan Museum of Art, but it would be a long and expensive journey.-->No

Did Dr. Seuss make himself famous###Dr. Seuss was born in 1904 as Theodor Seuss Geisel. He wrote his first book, And to Think That I Saw It on Mulberry Street, in 1937. It was rejected by 27 different publishers before finally being accepted. The book was not an immediate success. Dr. Seuss's fame began to grow after the publication of his second book, The 500 Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins, in 1938. By the early 1940s, Dr. Seuss was a well-known children's author. So, no, Dr. Seuss did not make himself famous.-->No

Can a grey seal swim in the same water as the subject of Moby Dick###First, we need to know what kind of water the subject of Moby Dick is in. The subject of Moby Dick is in the ocean. Next, we need to know if grey seals can swim in the ocean. Yes, grey seals can swim in the ocean.-->Yes

Did the 40th president of the United States forward lolcats to his friends###The 40th president of the United States was Ronald Reagan. There is no evidence that Ronald Reagan ever forwarded lolcats to his friends. Therefore, the answer to this question is most likely no.-->No

Would a vegetarian be able to eat something at Chick-fil-A###Chick-fil-A is a restaurant chain that specializes in chicken sandwiches. So right off the bat, we can say that a vegetarian probably wouldn't be able to find a sandwich that they could eat. However, Chick-fil-A does offer salads and sides that a vegetarian could eat.-->Yes

Will Queen Elizabeth be buried in the Pantheon###First, the Pantheon is a church, so it's possible that she could be buried there. Second, Queen Elizabeth II is still alive, so she hasn't been buried yet. Third, even if she were to die, it's unlikely that she would be buried in the Pantheon, since she is not a French citizen.-->No
